intro: Aquilegia gracillima, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a species of flowering plant in the Ranunculaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three finely divided leaflets, and it typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. Aquilegia gracillima prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens and alpine settings.
